events.originalText: A Tupolev Tu-154 of the Russian Defence Ministry crashed into the Black Sea shortly after taking off from Sochi International Airport, killing all 92 people on board.
events.subtitle: Tupolev Tu-154
events.headline: Russian Defence Ministry Tu-154 crashes into Black Sea, killing 92

events.originalText: Aboard Northwest Airlines Flight 253, Umar Farouk Abdulmutallab attempted to detonate plastic explosives hidden in his underwear.
events.subtitle: Northwest Airlines Flight 253
events.headline: Umar Farouk Abdulmutallab attempts bombing on Northwest Airlines Flight 253

events.originalText: A fire destroyed Longford's 19th-century St Mel's Cathedral, considered the "flagship cathedral" of the Irish midlands.
events.subtitle: Longford
events.headline: Fire destroys St Mel's Cathedral in Longford

events.originalText: A tiger at the San Francisco Zoo escaped from its enclosure and attacked three patrons before it was shot and killed.
events.subtitle: San Francisco Zoo
events.headline: Tiger escapes San Francisco Zoo enclosure, attacks patrons

events.originalText: Russian president Vladimir Putin signed into law a bill officially adopting a new national anthem, with music by Alexander Vasilyevich Alexandrov originally composed for the anthem of the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Vladimir Putin
events.headline: Vladimir Putin signs law adopting new Russian national anthem

events.originalText: In a nationally televised speech, Mikhail Gorbachev  resigned as President of the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Mikhail Gorbachev
events.headline: Mikhail Gorbachev resigns as President of Soviet Union

events.originalText: British computer programmer Tim Berners-Lee introduced WorldWideWeb, the world's first web browser and WYSIWYG HTML editor.
events.subtitle: Tim Berners-Lee
events.headline: Tim Berners-Lee introduces WorldWideWeb browser

events.originalText: Romanian Revolution: Communist dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu and his wife Elena were condemned to death on a wide range of charges and executed.
events.subtitle: Romanian revolution
events.headline: Nicolae Ceaușescu and wife Elena condemned to death

events.originalText: In Tamil Nadu, India, families of striking Dalit workers were massacred  by a gang, allegedly led by their landlords.
events.subtitle: Tamil Nadu
events.headline: Dalit workers' families massacred in Tamil Nadu

events.originalText: Four Scottish university students removed the Stone of Scone, used in the coronations of Scottish and British monarchs, from Westminster Abbey in London.
events.subtitle: 1950 removal of the Stone of Scone
events.headline: Scottish students remove Stone of Scone from Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: Second World War: The Japanese occupation of Hong Kong began when Mark Aitchison Young, the Governor of Hong Kong, surrendered the territory to Japan after 18 days of fierce fighting.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese occupation of Hong Kong begins after surrender by Governor

events.originalText: The Việt Nam Quốc Dân Đảng, a revolutionary socialist political party that sought Vietnamese independence from French colonial rule, was formed in Hanoi.
events.subtitle: Việt Nam Quốc Dân Đảng
events.headline: Việt Nam Quốc Dân Đảng formed in Hanoi for Vietnamese independence

events.originalText: A Baptist preacher named Samuel Sharpe began an unsuccessful eleven-day slave revolt in Jamaica.
events.subtitle: Baptists
events.headline: Samuel Sharpe starts unsuccessful slave revolt in Jamaica

events.originalText: American physician Ephraim McDowell performed the world's first removal of an ovarian tumor.
events.subtitle: Ephraim McDowell
events.headline: Ephraim McDowell performs first ovarian tumor removal

events.originalText: Based on predictions by Edmond Halley in 1705, Johann Georg Palitzsch observed a comet that was later named Halley's Comet (pictured).
events.subtitle: Edmond Halley
events.headline: Halley's Comet observed as predicted by Edmond Halley

events.originalText: Baldwin I was crowned the first king of Jerusalem (depicted) in the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem.
events.subtitle: Baldwin I of Jerusalem
events.headline: Baldwin I crowned first king of Jerusalem in Church of the Nativity

events.originalText: Norman Conquest: William the Conqueror was crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey, but continued to face rebellions over the following years and was not secure on the throne until after 1072.
events.subtitle: Norman Conquest
events.headline: William the Conqueror crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: Henry III was crowned Holy Roman Emperor by Pope Clement II.
events.subtitle: Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor
events.headline: Henry III crowned Holy Roman Emperor by Pope Clement II

events.originalText: After the death of Emperor Gongsun Shu of Chengjia, the empire was conquered by the Eastern Han dynasty.
events.subtitle: AD 36
events.headline: Eastern Han dynasty conquers empire after death of Emperor Gongsun Shu
